input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

تکتے رہنا ہائے! وہ پہروں تلک سوئے قمر 
 وہ پھٹے بادل ميں بے آواز پا اس کا سفر

ideal:
Oh! How I stared at the moon for long hours 
 Staring at its silent journey among broken clouds
completion:
Oh! U was used to stare at the moon for hours 
 I used to see it's silent journey in torn clouds

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

تکتے رہنا ہائے! وہ پہروں تلک سوئے قمر 
 وہ پھٹے بادل ميں بے آواز پا اس کا سفر

ideal:
Oh! How I stared at the moon for long hours 
 Staring at its silent journey among broken clouds
completion:
Hi! He sleeps till the moon sleeps 
 He finds his journey soundless in the torn cloud

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

تجھ ميں کچھ پيدا نہيں ديرينہ روزي کے نشاں 
 تو جواں ہے گردش شام و سحر کے درمياں

ideal:
Your condition does not show any signs of old age 
 You are young in the midst of day and night's alternation
completion:
There are no sign of oldness in you 
 You are still young in the alteration of day and night

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

تجھ ميں کچھ پيدا نہيں ديرينہ روزي کے نشاں 
 تو جواں ہے گردش شام و سحر کے درمياں

ideal:
Your condition does not show any signs of old age 
 You are young in the midst of day and night's alternation
completion:
There is no sign of long life in you 
 So the rotation is between dusk and dawn

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

تھا سراپا روح تو ، بزم سخن پيکر ترا 
 زيب محفل بھي رہا محفل سے پنہاں بھي رہا

ideal:
You were the complete soul, literary assembly was your body 
 You adorned as well as remained veiled from the assembly
completion:
You were like a soul to the litrary gatheing 
 You veiled from the gathering still you were the heart of it

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

تھا سراپا روح تو ، بزم سخن پيکر ترا 
 زيب محفل بھي رہا محفل سے پنہاں بھي رہا

ideal:
You were the complete soul, literary assembly was your body 
 You adorned as well as remained veiled from the assembly
completion:
There was a whole soul, body was center of gathering 
 Zeb remained at the party and stayed away from the party

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

خدا کي شان ہے ناچيز چيز بن بيٹھيں 
 جو بے شعور ہوں يوں باتميز بن بيٹھيں

ideal:
It is strange when the insignificant pose as important! 
 When the stupid ones like you pose as intelligent!
completion:
It is glory of God that insignificants are posing as important! 
 The stupid ones are posing as wise!

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

خدا کي شان ہے ناچيز چيز بن بيٹھيں 
 جو بے شعور ہوں يوں باتميز بن بيٹھيں

ideal:
It is strange when the insignificant pose as important! 
 When the stupid ones like you pose as intelligent!
completion:
It is the glory of God to become an insignificant thing 
 Those who are unconscious should become wise

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

لرزتا تھا ڈر سے مرا بال بال 
 قدم کا تھا دہشت سے اٹھنا محال

ideal:
Trembling all over with fear I was 
 Difficult to take even a step with fear was
completion:
My whole body used to shiver from fear 
 It was even difficult to take a single step out of fear

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

لرزتا تھا ڈر سے مرا بال بال 
 قدم کا تھا دہشت سے اٹھنا محال

ideal:
Trembling all over with fear I was 
 Difficult to take even a step with fear was
completion:
I was shaking with fear 
 It was impossible to get up from fear

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

ہے تجھے واسطہ مظاہر سے 
 اور باطن سے آشنا ہوں ميں

ideal:
Concerned with the manifest order you are 
 And acquainted with the inward I am
completion:
You are only concerned about the visible beauty 
 and I'm familiar with the internal details

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

ہے تجھے واسطہ مظاہر سے 
 اور باطن سے آشنا ہوں ميں

ideal:
Concerned with the manifest order you are 
 And acquainted with the inward I am
completion:
You are related to scenes 
 I am familiar with the inner working

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

پروں کو ميرے قدرت نے ضيا دي 
 تجھے اس نے صدائے دل ربا دي

ideal:
Nature has given light to my wings 
 It has given fascinating voice to you
completion:
Nature has been strengthened by wings 
 It has blessed you with amazing voice

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

پروں کو ميرے قدرت نے ضيا دي 
 تجھے اس نے صدائے دل ربا دي

ideal:
Nature has given light to my wings 
 It has given fascinating voice to you
completion:
The wings were increased by my power 
 He stole your heart

input.content: You'll be given a verse from Iqbal's poetry and your task is to translate it to English while preserving the correct meaning.

اگر جہاں ميں مرا جوہر آشکار ہوا 
 قلندري سے ہوا ہے، تو نگري سے نہيں

ideal:
Wealth has played no part, To bring my worth to light 
 My faqr has cast this spell, The share of wealth is slight
completion:
If the essence of death was revealed in Jahan 
 it happened from Qalandri, not from Nigri
